798.16.text: In the wild, pandas never raise twins

801.16.text:
and will always abandon
one cub after birth.

805.80.text:
At Wolong they've perfected a simple
method of raising twin cubs,

812.04.text: which has doubled the cub survival rate

814.44.text:
and had an obvious impact
on the captive panda population.

822.44.text: One cub stays with its mother after birth

825.20.text: and the other is nursed in an incubator.

827.84.text:
Then every so often
they're swapped over.

836.68.text:
It's a simple technique
and highly effective.

856.84.text: And while it's their turn in the nursery,

858.64.text:
the cubs have a taste
of one of the other things

861.32.text: that have boosted their survival rate.

870.04.text:

and formula milk,

was initially developed

880.32.text:
and it's improved the survival rate

894.04.text:
which gives newborn cubs some
